result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A Larocque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that today's hearing was set because the defendant still owes Restitution.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to proceed without an Attorney today.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant received a copy of the revocation packet.  
Atty Hendee makes recommendations.  Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court notes that the defendant has been making good faith effort and will permit discharge of Probation for January 8, 2018. 
Court will convert the outstanding balance as of January 8th, 2018 to a civil judgment.
to Court from Agent Jennifer Berger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Probation review hearing on December 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.
(Notice mailed to Probation and Parole - 10/11/17 kmk)

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: to Court from DOC
MOTION & ORDER REGARDING RESTITUTION
AMENDED INFORMATION

Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee files an amended information to Misd. failure to support with adding 2 more counts of Misd. failure to support making a total of 5 counts.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to counts 1 - 5.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the amended information.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a No contest plea to all 5 counts.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 - 5.

Atty Hendee asks for 10 days to submit the exact child support amount owing.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 - 5:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before February 6, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May serve in Clark County
No DNA Surcharge is ordered.
*Court Costs on each count = $243.00
*Full payment of Restitution (Child Support due and owing)
- Court gives 10 days to the State to provide the exact amount of Child Support due.
*Maintain full-time employment
*Comply with all job searches and orders in child support case
*Maintain current child support 
*Arrears may not accrue
Bond to be applied towards Child Support Restitution
Return date on January 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on December 19, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on December 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment on November 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is going to be waiving his right to a Prelim per Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive his right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Set for Arraignment.
State will file the information within 30 days.
bond continued.
  Arraignment scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.
State's

Attorney Mark J. Gumz appears by telephone in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Atty Gumz states that the defendant would like to waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendant's waiver of time limits.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Letter from Atty Mark Gumz dated 07-25-14

Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.  Defendant does not waive time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits not waived.  Set Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

-Keep Clerk of Courts informed of any address change.

Defendant Jesse A Larocque in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond.  Defendant states his current address is 520 S. Main St., Unity, WI. 54488.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 cash bond with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
